body: Added.

I will remove it
Does this PR fix #3891, #3985 and #2711? Or some of them?
Your YAML format breaks again :) Please fix it. And I think GSON doesn't require a new group. Add it to `PluginsTest / Webflux_SocketIO_RabbitMQ`, and rename the task please.

> Your YAML format breaks again :) Please fix it. And I think GSON doesn't require a new group. Add it to `PluginsTest / Webflux_SocketIO_RabbitMQ`, and rename the task please.

OK.

Please resolve the conflict. Should we merge this first, then working on verification in a new PR? This seems a little too long commit logs. As title `Add OAP+Istio(mixer) to CI pipeline`, this should be OK for now.

@innerpeacez @hanahmily Thoughts? @hanahmily Please review.

@codelipenghui The plugin test immigration is on going in these two months, a lot of the plugins have moved into PR related test process. #3583

Could any of you move the pulsar plugin test into the main repo too? The original plugin test env has been shut down. Moving into the main repo could make the pulsar plugin checked in every PR.
@wu-sheng Thanks for your reminder, will move the pulsar plugin test soon.

> the docs should state that the gateway plugin depends on the webflux plugin

Yes. Then should change
> Plugin of Spring Cloud Gateway 2.1.x in optional plugin folder. Please only active this plugin when you install agent in Spring Gateway.

to 
> Plugin of Spring Cloud Gateway 2.1.x in optional plugin folder. Please only active this plugin when you install agent in Spring Gateway. `spring-cloud-gateway-2.x-plugin` and `spring-webflux-5.x-plugin` are both required.

> #3985 and #2711 is fix, and the docs should state that the gateway plugin depends on the webflux plugin

I just added the `resolves` for those two bugs in your PRs.
Got it. And confirmed.
@arugal e2e just fails, I triggered re-run.
Because they are not released yet. They are new features in 6.6.0

@cyejing  Friendly ping, Look like you have lots experience in spring reactive, from this testcase, SkyWalking agent not supported Spring reactive WebClient component, If you wanna,  you can support https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/3992

Such as in your expected data file, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/86c35228991776eb53e208800f5159aa32d6909a/test/plugin/scenarios/webflux-scenario/config/expectedData.yaml

There are always entry spans, how could I link exit and local span in the segments? That is why we are using ContextManager. If you have concerns about thread switching, you should choose

`1. Create a snapshot to propagate.` Or `2. Create an async span to finish in another thread`.

It depends on your scenarios. If the whole thread is going to be used by another HTTP request, choose (1), if a span requires to finish in another thread, choose (2). Or both if you are in those cases.

> @cyejing Friendly ping, Look like you have lots experience in spring reactive, from this testcase, SkyWalking agent not supported Spring reactive WebClient component, If you wanna, you can support #3992

it can be support at an other PR is better .  i think.

> 1. Create a snapshot to propagate. Or 2. Create an async span to finish in another thread.

I tried this way, If two threads switch, will produce two spans with very short time spans, but the entire request time is very long.  
My approach is to let the ``Context`` manage the full request. The requested time span is also displayed normally. 
at reactive programming, If you want to rely on ThreadLocal to pass parameters, you will often encounter obstacles.  
so I think we should define a set of APIs suitable for reactive programming

For snapshot, yes, this could happen. But when you choose solution 2, you finish the span in another thread, why is the duration not right? I am not following. 

No matter what API for reactive you mean, you can't resolve the issue, the context needs to cooperate with other plugins. So eventually, you need back to the ThreadLocal in business local process. That is why we have `AbstractTracingSpan#prepareForAsync` and `AbstractTracingSpan#asyncFinish`.

> I tried this way, If two threads switch, will produce two spans with very short time spans, but the entire request time is very long.

I am giving you two options, not just one.
What do you mean webUI? Are you talking about Browser?

> What do you mean webUI? Are you talking about Browser?

Yes .  I am talking ablout  trace from brower or trace from a c++ native client
No, we don't have that. In theory, it is possible, but the cost will be high on network. You need to build your own client lib to follow the SkyWalking protocol.

> it is possible, but the cost will be high on network. You need to build your own client lib to follow the SkyWalking protocol.

Yes. I think you are right .Do this will cost hign.  But  some time.  Browser can do this  manually .

Can I send http  msg with http header 
```
key=sw3
value= 1.2343.234234234|1|1|1|#127.0.0.1:8080|#/portal/|#/testEntrySpan|1.2343.234234234
```
to app server ?

and do not send   this header to collector ?
So  skywalking can send tracing this msg ???
Header is for propagation, it is just required in the HTTP header. But you need to register your agent and send the trace segments to the backend. There are two protocols, header and trace protocols.

From the latest query protocol.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26432832/69972482-a6edd380-155c-11ea-84f8-71f8ba70cff0.png)

then use ``2. Create an async span to finish in another thread``

@gonedays From the source codes of Consul, none of your consul server nodes is healthy, after some time all of them are put into blacklist(`com.orbitz.consul.util.failover.strategy.BlacklistingConsulFailoverStrategy#markRequestFailed`), and finally you got `no value present` exception, check your consul nodes please

I think that is because when we do TTL in MySQL, TiDB, ShardingSphere. They are minute level, that is why. If you want to make it reasonable, they you need to separated different storage, it is possible. Do you want to contribute this?

@AirTrioa for an open-sourced project, all sorts of the questions can be answered by the source codes themselves.

> I checked all indexes of skywalking and found that there are two kinds of indexes: one is with time suffix, the other is without time suffix.

For those indices with suffix (ES), we use index template, and the indices will be automatically created by ES as long as they match the template name.

> Also, I would like to know if skywalking has a scheduled task? Thank you for your answer.

Yes, the class https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-core/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/core/storage/ttl/DataTTLKeeperTimer.java is what you're asking for

Proofread the main setup documents.

Wasn't sure exactly what was behind those two sentences in backend-ui-setup.md: about Jetty:


```
- All native agents and probes, either language based or mesh probe, are using gRPC service (`core/default/gRPC*` in `application.yml`) to report data to the backend. Also, jetty service supported in JSON format. 
- UI uses GraphQL (HTTP) query to access the backend also in Jetty service (`core/default/rest*` in `application.yml`).
```

First sentence: Is the meaning of the sentence about how Skywalking is ran in a Jetty server application, and communications are made in JSON?

The second sentence explains that the backend includes a graphql server used by the UI?

> All native agents and probes, either language based or mesh probe, are using gRPC service (`core/default/gRPC*` in `application.yml`) to report data to the backend. Also, jetty service supported in JSON format. 

All native known integrations today are all through gRPC with gRPC netty server, not Jetty. But for back-forward compatibility, we still keep Rest+JSON through Jetty server(old v5 protocol). Plan to remove this format or upgrade it to v6 after this year. At the same time, Jetty server also provides the web container for GraphQL query. Is that clear for you?
Now I'm not very familiar with skywalking，maybe I can contribute later.
I am not following your question. I don't think SkyWalking is blocking you from this. What do you mean how?
I very like to ,but I have a little trouble to understand the  meanings of  source code . I need to learn soure code further

I suddenly understand how to do it. I just need to implement my customized indirectmatch and implement the methods in it. My idea is that skywalking only enhances the @ bean annotation in my package, but not the spring's own.

> My idea is that skywalking only enhances the @ bean annotation in my package, but not the spring's own.

Yes, because we have concern too many spans created, which could cause performance issue. And in most cases, observing the beans inside Spring framework, it is not helpful.
I don't know actually, it depens why cglib error.
@zhaoyuguang Please recheck.
That is nearly impossible in production env. Once you provide this feature, the user may use this in the production env, then it will cause all ES and OAP cluster crash down.
The risk is not about confirmation, it is the health of the whole cluster.

It is true that the immutability of the ES underlying index determines that it is relatively inefficient to delete data. In addition, is it possible to provide functions such as ES cluster reinitialization? At the same time, each agent service is required to register again.
Yep!
Anything else to update? Or we could make this merge first?
Re-Register is provided already. If you want to do this, you could do manually, I don't think this should be a UI feature too.
Official test report for what?

Sorry ,please close the issue ,I find I cannot edit the content when I press the enter ,so I will submit a new standard issue ,thanks for your help

2019年12月6日 上午9:04，吴晟 Wu Sheng <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> 写道：


Official test report for what?

—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/4009?email_source=notifications&email_token=AHQZTUEQX6CE2EA7KF6MK2DQXGQKXA5CNFSM4JWGSBUKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOEGCVRAA#issuecomment-562387072>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AHQZTUGNIDLUAJLPI3AAVDTQXGQKXANCNFSM4JWGSBUA>.

> I want to know the aop system performance limit for all samples,
> I want to know the consumption of aop cluster resources and the qps it bears,

First of all, aop should be `OAP`. You have this typo in all your questions.
I think this is nearly impossible to provide official test. These cost a lot of resources, as we don't have that in the Apache foundation. There are some blogs on official website, http://skywalking.apache.org/blog/, posted by some PMC members. But they are mostly service mesh scenarios.

More people are more interested about agent performance rather than backend.

> And I also want to know the cost comparison between oap cluster and spark / message queue
> I know this statement is not strict,
> Specific test points:
> Does the trace node have a size limit, and if it is relatively large, does it affect the performance of aop?
> Aop qps bearer of each node under specific resource constraints
> How much performance can be improved over spark + queue at the same resource cost

We don't use traditional data analysis tech, big data-related because we don't care actually. If you learn more about the SkyWalking tracing module and analysis logic, you will know what I am talking about. So for my understanding, you can do by using spark or anything, but no performance change.

> Can i join sw's qq group

If you want, they are open to anyone. But tech related discussions only should happen on GitHub, or preferred on SkyWalking mail list.
@cyejing hi, What is the status of this pr?
The supported-list doc is required to update too.

I would like to know ， Execute in one thread `` span.prepareForAsync();  ContextManager.stopSpan(span);`` , How to modify operationName in another thread . ``setOperationName`` failed.

Could you share how fail?

> > How to modify operationName in another thread . setOperationName failed.

> Could you share how fail?

like my code shown  ``stackDepth`` is reduced because ``ContextManager.stopSpan`` .  ``ContextManager.stopSpan`` is executed to clean up the context of the current thread

> like my code shown stackDepth is reduced because ContextManager.stopSpan . ContextManager.stopSpan is executed to clean up the context of the current thread

When you have the async span, the `#stop` is only reducing the stackDepth as you said. But you still have span ref, right? You could propagate it to any thread, and operate it. The core will wait for you to do real async finish.

And the issue you posted is true, I didn't realize it before. I think all similar methods in `#EntrySpan` and `#ExitSpan` should add `setxxxInAsync`(work in `isInAsyncMode==true`) to ignore the `currentMaxDepth` and `stackDepth`. At the same time, `setxxx` should not work in `isInAsyncMode==true`. Make sense?

If YES, please submit a new pull request to adjust that. We should add them separately. The changes should begin with `AbstractSpan`.
I think to add `setOperationNameInAsync` should be enough, right? I don't have the scenario to do this for other methods.

Get solution for this, just add the Converter in logback.xml:

```
<configuration>
<!--add converter for %tid-->
<conversionRule conversionWord="tid" converterClass="org.apache.skywalking.apm.toolkit.log.logback.v1.x.LogbackPatternConverter"/>

<!--appender-->
<appender name="logstash" class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender">
        <file>${LOG_PATH:-.}/${APP_NAME}/${APP_NAME}_json.log</file>
        <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy">
            <fileNamePattern>${LOG_PATH:-.}/${APP_NAME}/${APP_NAME}_json.log.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.gz</fileNamePattern>
            <maxHistory>30</maxHistory>
        </rollingPolicy>
        <encoder class="net.logstash.logback.encoder.LoggingEventCompositeJsonEncoder">
            <providers>
                <timestamp>
                    <timeZone>UTC</timeZone>
                </timestamp>
                <pattern>
                    <pattern>
                        {
                        "level": "%level",
                        "ip": "${IP}",
                        "service": "${APP_NAME:-}",
                        "tid": "%tid",
                        "pid": "${PID:-}",
                        "thread": "%thread",
                        "class": "%logger{1.}:%L",
                        "message": "%message",
                        "stackTrace": "%exception{10}"
                        }
                    </pattern>
                </pattern>
            </providers>
        </encoder>
    </appender>

</configuration>

```
 Thanks anyway.
If this missed in the document, could you send a pull request to add this in the document?
